2. Import substitution: Governments could encourage domestic production of goods that are in short supply, in order to reduce dependence on imported goods.
3. Social safety nets: Governments could increase funding for social safety nets, such as unemployment benefits and food assistance, to help those who are struggling financially.
4. Diversifying trade: Governments could seek new trade partners and diversify trade in order to reduce dependence on any single country.
5. Encouraging innovation: Governments could invest in technology and innovation to promote new industries and create new jobs.
